intro: Erigeron inornatus var. keilii, commonly known as the Keil's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and open plains. Its foliage is usually gray-green with a fuzzy texture, and it produces small, daisy-like blooms in shades of white and yellow. This variety is often found in disturbed areas and is adapted to thrive in low-nutrient conditions.
